name: places/ChIJw_O7wVtYwokRpsR-BPGH5Fo
formattedAddress: 528 W 57th St, New York, NY 10019, USA
adrFormatAddress: 528 W 57th St, New York, NY 10019, USA

originalText.text:
What an amazing experience! We got tickets on Friday, just 2 days before the show. Got there at about 5 pm, we were one of the first ones to get there. We waited for about an hour and then they sent us up the elevator to the studio and gave us front row seats! Some other guy warmed up the crowd for a while and John Oliver arrived at about 7pm! He is awesome! He did a 10min Q&A with the audience, and then we got started with the show.The actual taping was real quick, wrapped up within 30 mins, with just a couple of retakes!

Tip: Seating is strictly first come first serve, so if you wanna be in the front rows, get there early!

text.text:
What an amazing experience! We got tickets on Friday, just 2 days before the show. Got there at about 5 pm, we were one of the first ones to get there. We waited for about an hour and then they sent us up the elevator to the studio and gave us front row seats! Some other guy warmed up the crowd for a while and John Oliver arrived at about 7pm! He is awesome! He did a 10min Q&A with the audience, and then we got started with the show.The actual taping was real quick, wrapped up within 30 mins, with just a couple of retakes!

Tip: Seating is strictly first come first serve, so if you wanna be in the front rows, get there early!

originalText.text:
We got free tickets by signing up to the lottery online. On the day of keep an eye on your phones, you may get in because of last minute cancellations.

The entrance is very easy to find - there’s a large sign. We were required to show proof of vaccination and wear the supplied mask. Inside we waited for 1.5 hours, apparently a bit longer than usual. Then up to the studio (seating around 150 or so people), the earlier you arrive, the more forward you sit.

There was another stand up getting the crowd warm and then on came John Oliver. A short Q&A with the audience and then the taping, which lasted about as long as the show, with a few short retakes of some of the segments.

Overall a great experience, if you can get tickets, go for it!

originalText.text: John Oliver is amazing. The show is very tightly managed. However, the lottery tickets are overrated. I waited in the standby line and everyone in the standby line eventually got a ticket

originalText.text: Fantastic show! Little Johnny loved seeing his dad in the limelight!

text.text: Fantastic show! Little Johnny loved seeing his dad in the limelight!

originalText.text: Friendly staff helped make this John Oliver screening truly an experience to remember. If you enjoy watching his show, I 100% recommend you try to get free tickets in the lottery and know that you may be contacted last minute if they have some spots open up!
